author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Defence Ministry has ordered an enquiry by the Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) against two serving Major Generals in the Army for having disproportionate assets.

The officers in question are Maj. Gen. Ashok Kumar from the Army Service Corps (ASC) and Maj. Gen. S.S. Lamba from the Army Ordinance Corps (AOC).

The Ministry sources on Thursday confirmed the development and said Defence Minister Manohar Parrikar had asked the CBI to look into the matter.

The CBI sources said that they had just received the communication but are yet to go through the files.

Allegations of bribe had surfaced in promotions to the rank of Lieutenant General after the Army Promotion Board submitted its recommendations to the Ministry.

Incidentally both the officers were awarded Ati Vishisht Seva Medal in 2015 for distinguished service.
title: CBI probe ordered against 2 serving Major Generals
